      • lock

        public void lock(Object maintainer)
          throws CouldNotPerformException
        This method allows to lock this instance to make sure no other instances can maintain these one. This could for example be useful if the management of this instance should be restricted to an instance pool. Note: After a successfully lock only the maintainer is able to unlock this instance.
        Specified by:
        lock in interface Lockable
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown if the remote could not be locked.

      • activate

        public void activate(boolean waitForData)
              throws InterruptedException,
                     CouldNotPerformException
        Method activates the remote instance and blocks until the first data synchronization is done. Equivalent of: activate(); waitForData(0); Caution: Method can blocks forever if the related main controller instance will be never available!
        Specified by:
        activate in interface Remote<M extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage>
        Parameters:
        waitForData - if this flag is true the method will block until the first data synchronization is done.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the activation is interrupted
        CouldNotPerformException - if the activation could not be performed

        public <R> Future<R> callMethodAsync(String methodName)
                              throws CouldNotPerformException
        Method asynchronously calls the given method without any arguments on the main controller.
        Specified by:

        Type Parameters:
        R - the return type of the method declaration.
        Parameters:
        methodName - the method name.
        Returns:
        a future instance which gives feedback about the asynchronously method call and when the result is available.

      • callMethod

        public <R> R callMethod(String methodName)
                 throws CouldNotPerformException,
                        InterruptedException
        Method synchronously calls the given method without any arguments on the main controller. The method call will block until the call is successfully processed. Even if the main controller instance is currently not reachable, successively retry will be triggered. The only way to cancel the call is an externally interruption of the invoking thread.
        Specified by:
        callMethod in interface RSBRemote<M extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage>
        Type Parameters:
        R - the return type of the method declaration.
        Parameters:
        methodName - the method name.
        Returns:
        the return value of the remote method.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown in case any error occurred during processing.
        InterruptedException - is thrown in case the thread was externally interrupted.

      • callMethod

        public <R,T> R callMethod(String methodName,
                          T argument)
                   throws CouldNotPerformException,
                          InterruptedException
        Method synchronously calls the given method on the main controller. The method call will block until the call is successfully processed. Even if the main controller instance is currently not reachable, successively retry will be triggered. The only way to cancel the call is an externally interruption of the invoking thread.
        Specified by:
        callMethod in interface RSBRemote<M extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage>
        Type Parameters:
        R - the return type of the method declaration.
        T - the argument type of the method.
        Parameters:
        methodName - the method name.
        argument - the method argument.
        Returns:
        the return value of the remote method.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown in case any error occurred during processing.
        InterruptedException - is thrown in case the thread was externally interrupted.

      • callMethod

        public <R> R callMethod(String methodName,
                        long timeout)
                 throws CouldNotPerformException,
                        TimeoutException,
                        InterruptedException
        Method synchronously calls the given method on the main controller. The method call will block until the call is successfully processed or the given timeout is expired. Even if the main controller instance is currently not reachable, successively retry will be triggered.
        Specified by:
        callMethod in interface RSBRemote<M extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage>
        Type Parameters:
        R - the return type of the method declaration.
        Parameters:
        methodName - the method name.
        timeout - the RPC call timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the return value of the remote method.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown in case any error occurred during processing.
        InterruptedException - is thrown in case the thread was externally interrupted.
        TimeoutException - is thrown in case the given timeout is expired before the RPC was successfully processed.

      • callMethod

        public <R,T> R callMethod(String methodName,
                          T argument,
                          long timeout)
                   throws CouldNotPerformException,
                          TimeoutException,
                          InterruptedException
        Method synchronously calls the given method on the main controller. The method call will block until the call is successfully processed or the given timeout is expired. Even if the main controller instance is currently not reachable, successively retry will be triggered.
        Specified by:
        callMethod in interface RSBRemote<M extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage>
        Type Parameters:
        R - the return type of the method declaration.
        T - the argument type of the method.
        Parameters:
        methodName - the method name.
        argument - the method argument.
        timeout - the RPC call timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the return value of the remote method.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown in case any error occurred during processing.
        InterruptedException - is thrown in case the thread was externally interrupted.
        TimeoutException - is thrown in case the given timeout is expired before the RPC was successfully processed.

      • requestData

        public CompletableFuture<M> requestData()
                                 throws CouldNotPerformException
        This method synchronizes this remote instance with the main controller and returns the new data object. Normally, all server data changes are automatically synchronized to all remote instances. In case you have triggered many server changes, this changes are sequentially applied. With this method you can force the sync to get instantly a data object with all applied changes. This action can not be canceled! Use this method with caution because high frequently calls will reduce the network performance! The preferred by to access the data object
        Specified by:
        requestData in interface Remote<M extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage>
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture which gives feedback about the successful synchronization.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - In case the sync could not be triggered an CouldNotPerformException will be thrown.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        This method deactivates the remote and cleans all resources.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Shutdownable

      • getData

        public M getData()
          throws NotAvailableException
        Method returns the data object of this remote which is synchronized with the server data in background. In case the data was never received not available a NotAvailableException is thrown. Use method getDataFuture() to get feedback about the synchronization state, or use method waitForData() to block until the needed data is synchronized.
        Specified by:
        getData in interface DataProvider<M extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage>
        Specified by:
        getData in interface Remote<M extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage>
        Returns:
        the data object of the remote.
        Throws:
        NotAvailableException - is thrown in case the data is not yet synchronized with the main controller instance.

      • waitForData

        public void waitForData()
                 throws CouldNotPerformException,
                        InterruptedException
        Method blocks until an initial data message was received from the remote controller.
        Specified by:
        waitForData in interface DataProvider<M extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage>
        Specified by:
        waitForData in interface Remote<M extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage>
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown if any error occurs.
        InterruptedException - is thrown in case the thread is externally interrupted.

      • waitForData

        public void waitForData(long timeout,
                        TimeUnit timeUnit)
                 throws CouldNotPerformException,
                        InterruptedException
        Method blocks until an initial data message was received from the main controller or the given timeout is reached.
        Specified by:
        waitForData in interface DataProvider<M extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage>
        Specified by:
        waitForData in interface Remote<M extends com.google.protobuf.GeneratedMessage>
        Parameters:
        timeout - maximal time to wait for the main controller data. After the timeout is reached a NotAvailableException is thrown which is caused by a TimeoutException.
        timeUnit - the time unit of the timeout.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown in case the any error occurs, or if the given timeout is reached. In this case a TimeoutException is thrown.
        InterruptedException - is thrown in case the thread is externally interrupted.

      • waitForConnectionState

        public void waitForConnectionState(Remote.ConnectionState connectionState,
                                   long timeout)
                            throws InterruptedException,
                                   TimeoutException,
                                   CouldNotPerformException
        Method blocks until the remote reaches the desired connection state. In case the timeout is expired an TimeoutException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        connectionState - the desired connection state
        timeout - the timeout in milliseconds until the method throw a TimeoutException in case the connection state was not reached.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - is thrown in case the thread is externally interrupted.
        TimeoutException - is thrown in case the timeout is expired without reaching the connection state.
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown in case the the remote is not active and the waiting condition is based on ConnectionState CONNECTED or CONNECTING.

      • waitForConnectionState

        public void waitForConnectionState(Remote.ConnectionState connectionState)
                            throws InterruptedException,
                                   CouldNotPerformException
        Method blocks until the remote reaches the desired connection state.
        Parameters:
        connectionState - the desired connection state
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - is thrown in case the thread is externally interrupted.
        CouldNotPerformException - is thrown in case the the remote is not active and the waiting condition is based on ConnectionState CONNECTED or CONNECTING.

      • ping

        public Future<Long> ping()
        Method triggers a ping between this remote and its main controller and returns the calculated connection delay. This method is triggered automatically in background to check if the main controller is still available.
        Returns:
        the connection delay in milliseconds.

      • getPing

        public long getPing()
        Method returns the result of the latest connection ping between this remote and its main controller.
        Returns:
        the latest connection delay in milliseconds.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Method prints a class instance representation.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        the class string representation.
